decision_conditions: <p><span style="line-height: normal;">The proposed first floor rear extension by reason of its excessive width and depth would result in a cramped, disproportionate and incongruous addition to the dwellinghouse which would fail to respect the proportions of the host property. The proposed development would result in a detrimental impact to the character and appearance of the host property and would break the established building line of the group of dwellings the site forms part of</span>&nbsp;(No.63, 65 and 67), thereby resulting in a detrimental impact to the visual amenities of the area. The proposal is therefore contrary to the high quality design aspirations of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), D3.D(1) and D3.D(11) of The London Plan (2021), Core Policy CS1.B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012), Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).</p>

<p>The proposed first floor rear extension by reason of its size and siting&nbsp;would result in an overly prominent and overbearing development which result in a detrimental impact to the visual and residential amenities of No.65 Peel Road due to a loss of outlook, light and a sense of enclosure. The proposal is therefore contrary to the high quality design aspirations of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy D3.D(7) of The&nbsp; London Plan (2021),&nbsp; Policy DM1.C of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).</p>
description: Single storey side extension; single and two storey rear extension (Demolition of rear conservatory)
